headline.print_headline: North Carolina Lawmakers Order Coal Ash Pond Cleanup After Duke Spill
headline.main: North Carolina Lawmakers Order Coal Ash Pond Cleanup After Duke Spill

docs.snippet: North Carolina's state Senate on Wednesday unanimously approved a bill calling for the closure of Duke Energy's 33 coal ash ponds in the state within 15 years, legislation spurred by a massive spill at a retired power plant earlier this year....
docs.lead_paragraph: North Carolina's state Senate on Wednesday unanimously approved a bill calling for the closure of Duke Energy's 33 coal ash ponds in the state within 15 years, legislation spurred by a massive spill at a retired power plant earlier this year.

headline.print_headline: 2 Top Veterans Affairs Officials Leaving Jobs
headline.main: 2 Top Veterans Affairs Officials Leaving Jobs

docs.snippet: Two top Department of Veterans Affairs officials are stepping down, the beleaguered agency announced Wednesday as it continued reeling from complaints that thousands of veterans have endured long waits for appointments and poor medical care....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two top Department of Veterans Affairs officials are stepping down, the beleaguered agency announced Wednesday as it continued reeling from complaints that thousands of veterans have endured long waits for appointments and poor medical care.

headline.print_headline: Oscar Organizers Outline New Regulations for Music Categories
headline.main: Oscar Organizers Outline New Regulations for Music Categories

docs.snippet: The organizers of the Academy Awards are putting rules in place for next year to prevent any missteps in the film campaign process, targeting the music categories....
docs.lead_paragraph: The organizers of the Academy Awards are putting rules in place for next year to prevent any missteps in the film campaign process, targeting the music categories.

headline.main: What the Aereo Decision Means for TV

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court ruled that Aereo violated copyright law, granting television networks a much-desired win that will preserve the status quo — at least for now....

byline.original: Natalia V. Osipova and Mona El-Naggar

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court ruled that Aereo violated copyright law, granting television networks a much-desired win that will preserve the status quo — at least for now.

headline.print_headline: New York Airports Play Catch Up on Free Wi-Fi Access
headline.main: New York Airports Play Catch Up on Free Wi-Fi Access

docs.snippet: Airports in the New York City area will soon join others in major U.S. cities that offer free wireless Internet access, under a plan approved on Wednesday by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey's Board of Commissioners....
docs.lead_paragraph: Airports in the New York City area will soon join others in major U.S. cities that offer free wireless Internet access, under a plan approved on Wednesday by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey's Board of Commissioners.
